alert.note: Alert for McHenry (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 28 at 10:33PM CDT until July 29 at 2:00AM CDT by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 AM CDT SATURDAY... ...FLASH FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FOR ROCKFORD METRO AREA... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...Portions of north central Illinois and northeast Illinois, including the following areas, in north central Illinois, Boone and Winnebago. In northeast Illinois, McHenry. * WHEN...Until 145 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Creeks and streams may rise out of their banks. Flooding may occur in poor drainage and urban areas. Roads and streets may be flooded. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1028 PM CDT, doppler radar indicated that rainfall rates have begun to diminish across the area, with light rain expected to continue for the next few hours. Up to 3 inches of rain have fallen between Huntley and Crystal Lake. Minor street flooding may be slow to recede. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Rockford, Crystal Lake, Algonquin, Lake in the Hills, McHenry, Belvidere, Woodstock, Huntley, Loves Park, Machesney Park, Roscoe, Fox Lake, Harvard, Island Lake, South Beloit, Rockton, Marengo, Poplar Grove, Rockford Airport and Cary. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: A Flood Advisory means minor flooding along waterways and other poor drainage areas is imminent or may already be occurring. Persons in the advisory area should use caution and avoid flood waters.
